org.strongback.control

Interface PIDController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Controller, Requirable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TalonController
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SoftwarePIDController

    @ThreadSafe
public interface PIDController
extends Controller
    A Controller extension for Proportional Integral Differential (PID) controllers with optional support for feed forward.

    Profiles

    Each PIDController instance is able to have 1 or more independent sets of PID gains, called profiles. One of these profiles is always in use, and by default it is the "default" profile. Additional profiles can be defined, and then while in operation the gains for the controller can be switched to any of the named profiles.

      • withProfile

        default PIDController withProfile(int profile,
                                  double p,
                                  double i,
                                  double d)
        Set the control gains for the specified profile, which may or may not be the current profile. Profile numbers start from 0 and can include any integers, although consecutive non-zero numbers are encouraged. The default profile is 0.
        Parameters:
        profile - the profile number; a new profile will be created if a profile with the number does not exist may be an existing or new profile
        p - the proportional gain
        i - the integral gain
        d - the differential gain
        Returns:
        this object so that methods can be chained; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the profile name is null
